message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper discusses language model training data selection, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also presents an information-theoretic method, which involves measuring the bits of information to be gained by adding one text to another, indicating a possible connection to cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of language models and corpora, which are relevant to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper mentions the use of vocabulary counts, which could be related to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
